name: Governance & Strategy
description: How security aligns with business objectives, leadership accountability, policies, budgets and metrics. Covers strategic planning, executive oversight, and organizational structure.

name: Risk Management
description: How cybersecurity risks are identified, assessed, tracked, and integrated into enterprise risk management. Includes risk assessment methodologies and risk treatment strategies.

name: Asset Management
description: How hardware, software, and data assets are inventoried, classified, and managed throughout their lifecycle. Covers asset discovery, tracking, and disposal.

name: Identity & Access Management (IAM)
description: How identities, MFA, privileged accounts and access controls are managed across systems and cloud platforms. Includes authentication, authorization, and identity governance.

name: Network Security
description: How networks are segmented, monitored, and protected from unauthorized access. Covers firewalls, network segmentation, VPNs, and network monitoring.

name: Endpoint Security
description: How workstations, laptops, mobile devices, and servers are protected from malware and threats. Includes antivirus, EDR, patch management, and device hardening.

name: Data Protection & Privacy
description: How sensitive data is classified, encrypted, and protected throughout its lifecycle. Covers data loss prevention, encryption, backup, and privacy compliance.

name: Application Security
description: How applications are developed, tested, and secured throughout the SDLC. Includes secure coding, vulnerability testing, and DevSecOps practices.

name: Cloud & Container Security
description: How cloud environments and containerized workloads are configured, monitored and protected. Covers AWS, Azure, GCP, Kubernetes, and cloud-native security.

name: Incident Response & Resilience
description: How security incidents are detected, responded to, and recovered from. Includes incident response plans, playbooks, and post-incident analysis.

name: Business Continuity
description: How critical business functions are maintained during disruptions. Covers business continuity planning, disaster recovery, and resilience testing.

name: Vendor Management
description: How third-party vendors and suppliers are assessed, monitored, and managed for security risks. Includes vendor risk assessments and contract security requirements.

name: Security Awareness & Training
description: How employees are educated about security threats and best practices. Covers security training programs, phishing simulations, and awareness campaigns.

name: Physical Security
description: How physical facilities, data centers, and equipment are protected from unauthorized access. Covers access controls, surveillance, and environmental controls.

name: Monitoring & Detection
description: How security events are monitored, logged, and analyzed for threats. Covers SIEM, log management, threat detection, and security operations.

name: Vulnerability Management
description: How vulnerabilities are identified, prioritized, and remediated across the environment. Includes vulnerability scanning, patch management, and remediation tracking.

name: Compliance & Audit
description: How the organization meets regulatory requirements and industry standards. Covers compliance frameworks, audit readiness, and regulatory reporting.

name: OT/ICS & IoT Security
description: How industrial control systems, SCADA and OT environments are segmented, monitored and secured. Covers operational technology and IoT device security.

name: AI/ML & Machine Learning Security
description: How AI and machine learning systems are secured and how AI is used for security purposes. Covers model security, data privacy, and AI-powered security tools.
